::Element::

Element watches Motormaster calmly, careful to control his anger. He 
reaches into a compartment and draws a rifle, aiming it at 
Motormaster.

"I don't bluff either. Put that Maximal down or you won't survive the 
trip back yourself."

He glances around the Stunticons, and then at Astroblast. "You can't 
all fit in that shuttle, and I can garauntee that I can catch any 
that are left behind. Besides, the other Maximals will aid me. Give 
me the Maximal and I will give you safe passage. Otherwise, quite a 
few of you will die."

He looks at Motormaster for the bot's reply. The four circling 
missiles were ready to plunge down at Motormaster. Element was 
getting ready to do a mental manuever.



--- In nbwrpg@y..., Robert Dahl <rdahl@s...> wrote:
> Menasor looks around, having problems understanding the 
situation, "Why
> Menasor not just kill Maximal then" he says in a low growl of a 
voice, "and
> we kill the one at base tooo" he screamed threteningly. He then 
disingaged,
> in a complex transformation, and flash of light, his legs turned 
into
> Speedbreaker and Wildrider, who started to float again, and 
Wildrider had
> an ugly smile, with half of his face missing, yet he was grinning 
with
> glee. The middle section becomes Motormaster, and he grabs Firearm, 
on
> hovers to land on top of Astroblast, and puts his cyclone gun to 
the robots
> head. Meanwhile Dead-End and Drag Strip transform, Drag Strip 
starts to
> soar, but the charred out body of Dead-End starts to plummet, 
motionless,
> straight into Speedbreakers grip, who holds him firmly in mid air. 
(Okay
> rAuq, theyre yours again). "Seriously Maximal, we have enough 
equipment in
> Astroblast to patch him up to survive the trip. And I am not 
bluffing, if
> we cant take him back to base, then he dies, as well as the other, 
do you
> really want to be held responsible for two Maximals deaths, hah, 
that's not
> very Maximal of you. And I dont bluff" screamed Motormaster with 
fury in
> his eyes, he had had enough, and except for minor damage to his 
back and
> neck, and a hole in his front, he was fine, and more than capable 
of firing
> quickly.
